info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 11:20AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT... WEATHER... * Temperatures will continue to hover around the freezing mark into the early afternoon hours as precipitation continues to occur over Midland and Bay counties. Much of this precipitation will fall in the form of freezing rain. * Freezing rain rates up to 0.02 inch per hour will be possible, with light icing accumulation possible especially in interior portions of Midland and Bay counties where temperatures are most likely to remain just below freezing. * In addition to the potential for freezing rain, areas of fog will be possible into the early afternoon hours, locally dense at times. Visibility may be restricted below 1/2 mile at times. IMPACTS... * Light icing will lead to hazardous conditions on untreated roads and walking surfaces. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for hazardous driving conditions by slowing down and allowing extra time. * Motorists should also take into account extra travel times and use low beam headlights due to low visibility in areas of fog. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
